prompt: <description>**Construct the base part of the rectangular prism** The base part of the rectangular prism is a scaled and extruded 2D sketch. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] 2. Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch consists of two loops, loop_1 and loop_2, which in turn consist of lines. - loop_1: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1155, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.1155, 0.0], End Point [0.1155, 0.0555] - line_3: Start Point [0.1155, 0.0555], End Point [0.0, 0.0555] - line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.0555], End Point [0.0, 0.0] - loop_2: - line_1: Start Point [0.003, 0.003], End Point [0.1125, 0.003] - line_2: Start Point [0.1125, 0.003], End Point [0.1125, 0.0525] - line_3: Start Point [0.1125, 0.0525], End Point [0.003, 0.0525] - line_4: Start Point [0.003, 0.0525], End Point [0.003, 0.003] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1155. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal by a depth of 0.75 units and opposite normal by a depth of 0 units. The sketch scale factor is 0.1155. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.75,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.1155,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.1155,0.0],"End Point":[0.1155,0.0555]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.1155,0.0555],"End Point":[0.0,0.0555]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0555],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}},"loop_2":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.003,0.003],"End Point":[0.1125,0.003]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.1125,0.003],"End Point":[0.1125,0.0525]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.1125,0.0525],"End Point":[0.003,0.0525]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.003,0.0525],"End Point":[0.003,0.003]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.1155,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top and Bottom The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. This part is constructed by creating a new coordinate system, a 2D sketch, and then extruding the sketch to a 3D model. Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system for this part with no rotation (euler\\_angles = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Sketch The sketch is drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. It consists of two faces, each having one loop. Face 1 Face 1 is drawn on the XY plane and has a single loop (loop\\_1). This loop is composed of four straight lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4). The lines form a rectangle: * line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.54, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point = [0.54, 0.0], End Point = [0.54, 0.54] * line\\_3: Start Point = [0.54, 0.54], End Point = [0.0, 0.54] * line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.54], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Face 2 Face 2 is constructed in a similar manner to Face 1. Extrusion After creating the sketch, the final step is to extrude the sketch into the third dimension. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.75 units in the positive Z direction (towards the normal), with no extrusion in the opposite direction (extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal = 0.0). The sketch is scaled by a factor of 0.54 (sketch\\_scale = 0.54), resulting in the part having the desired dimensions for the tapered top and bottom. This part represents a NewBodyFeatureOperation. Combining this with any previous parts will result in a new solid body for the CAD assembly.</description>

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.54,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.54,0.0],"End Point":[0.54,0.54]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.54,0.54],"End Point":[0.0,0.54]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.54],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}},"loop_2":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.045,0.045],"End Point":[0.495,0.045]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.495,0.045],"End Point":[0.495,0.495]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.495,0.495],"End Point":[0.045,0.495]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.045,0.495],"End Point":[0.045,0.045]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.54,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system.** Create a loop with the following lines: - Line 1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.75, 0.0]. - Line 2: Start point at [0.75, 0.0], end point at [0.75, 0.39]. - Line 3: Start point at [0.75, 0.39], end point at [0.0, 0.39]. - Line 4: Start point at [0.0, 0.39], end point at [0.0, 0.0]. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch.** Apply a uniform scale of 0.75 to the sketch. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** Keep the default euler angles and translation vector. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model.** Extrude the sketch by 0.24 units towards the normal. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0225, 0.0225, 0.48]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system.** Create a loop with the following lines: - Line 1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.7275, 0.0]. - Line 2: Start point at [0.7275, 0.0], end point at [0.7275, 0.345]. - Line 3: Start point at [0.7275, 0.345], end point at [0.0, 0.345]. - Line 4: Start point at [0.0, 0.345], end point at [0.0, 0.0]. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch.** Apply a uniform scale of 0.7275 to the sketch. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** Keep the default euler angles and translation vector. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model.** Extrude the sketch by 0.2175 units in the opposite direction of the normals. The resulting shape has a flat top and bottom, with a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units, and it is centered in the image.</description>

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.39]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.39],"End Point":[0.0,0.39]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.39],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.24,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0225,0.0225,0.24]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.7275,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.7275,0.0],"End Point":[0.7275,0.345]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.7275,0.345],"End Point":[0.0,0.345]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.345],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.2175,"sketch_scale":0.7275,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the sides are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The curved top has a radius of approximately 1 unit, and the flat bottom is a square with sides of approximately 2 units. The height of the prism is approximately 3 units. **Step 1: Create a coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5925, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** On the plane defined by the new coordinate system, draw a 2D sketch with the following components: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.75, 0.0]. - Line 2: Starting at [0.75, 0.0], ending at [0.75, 0.375]. - Arc 1: Starting at [0.75, 0.375], with a mid point at [0.4026, 0.4026], ending at [0.375, 0.75]. - Line 3: Starting at [0.375, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.75]. - Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.0]. **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.5925 units towards the normal and 0 units towards the opposite direction of the normal. The shape will now be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a height of 0.75 x 0.5925 = 0.4444 units. The width will be the same as the length of the base, which is 0.75 units, and the height will be 0.5925 units, making the total height of the prism approximately 3 units, including the curved top. The final dimensions of the prism, including the curved top, are 0.75 units in length, 0.5925 units in width, and 2.5925 units in height. The curved top has a radius of approximately 1 unit, which can be inferred from the 2D sketch.</description>

<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.5925,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.375]},"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.375],"Mid Point":[0.4026,0.4026],"End Point":[0.375,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.375,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5925,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
